message.content:
{"id": "49299", 
 "title": "Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting", 
 "description": "Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 mentions that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (given that URL rewriting has been enabled). However, in the actual result, the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' but the 'Reload' link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead.", 
 "OB": "In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that a custom cookie name for session tracking affects URL rewriting. However, in this scenario, the custom cookie name is not being used for URL rewriting.", 
 "EB": "The expected behavior is that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name should be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled).", 
 "SR": "To reproduce this issue: 1. Deploy the attached war file 'cookiename.war'. 2. Access 'http://localhost:8080/cookiename/'."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49299', 'title': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting', 'description': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting ', 'OB': 'Created attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.warIn chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf it is said that"If a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, thesame custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the sessionid is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). Actual result:The page sends the following cookie:SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnlybut the Reload link on the page uses "jsessionid":http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': '"That is not true for the current trunk: the default "jsessionid" is used instead.I am attaching a war file that reproduces this issue.Steps to reproduce:1. Deploy it as cookiename.war2. Access http://localhost:8080/cookiename/3. '}
